amendment.description: To require the Secretary of Labor, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of Education to report to Congress on acquisitions made by each Department of articles, materials, or supplies manufactured outside the United States.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1633 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 1633 proposed by Senator Harkin for Senator Feingold to Amendment SA 1542. (consideration: CR 9/11/2003 S11321-11324; text: CR 9/11/2003 S11323) To require the Secretary of Labor, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of Education to report to Congress on acquisitions made by each Department of articles, materials, or supplies manufactured outside the United States.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1633 proposed by Senator Harkin for Senator Feingold to Amendment SA 1542.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1633 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
